result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Juan Perez-Salazar

records.addlTxt: Email correspondence held with parties regarding request for an adjournment. No objection from the State, case is rescheduled. Parties notified of new court date.
Received and filed; forwarded to the Judge for review.

Defendant Juan Perez-Salazar in court with attorney Christopher Scott Carson.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defense counsel advises that parties are in a resolution posture. Court grants request and adjourns matter for a Plea/ Sentencing date to Br 16.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 8.2.22

Defendant Juan Perez-Salazar in court, appear in person with attorney Christopher Scott Carson, appear in person.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 16, Judge Grayson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 16. Court Cancelled stayed bench warrant.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: LVD

Defendant Juan Perez-Salazar not in court.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Carson is unable to appear. Defendant does not appear. Court will impose, but stay a warrant until the next date. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Notice of Retainer

Adjustment Number: 22A 043625,
Payable Number: 1004672,
Receipt Number: 22RP018231,
Amount: $20.00
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 5.4.22
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Maricela L-R.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Juan Perez-Salazar in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Defendant Juan Perez-Salazar in custody.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Juan Perez-Salazar appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
